actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law

official_title: A bill to establish a Temporary National Commission on Economic Concentration.

summary.text: Establishes the Temporary National Commission on Economic Concentration to: (1) study monopoly and the concentration of economic power in and financial control over production and distribution of goods and services; and (2) make recommendations to the Congress on such subjects, including the improvement of an antitrust policy and national standards for corporations engaged in commerce. Authorizes appropriations. Requires a final report to the President and the Congress prior to the end of the 101st Congress. Terminates the Commission on December 31, 1990.

titles.title: A bill to establish a Temporary National Commission on Economic Concentration.
